Transcript: Alan: Well, gus, good morning.
Gus: Morning.

Alan: What can I do for you? Well, you don't have to answer me now. You could 
wait until later if you feel like it.
Gus: No, no. Just... you got a busy day at the office?

Alan: I'm not going to the office. I'm going down to try to cut a deal with 
jeffrey o'neill. You look surprised.

Gus: No, I just think it's good that you're going to take the high road, you 
know?
Alan: More like saving my own skin, don't you think?
Gus: No, no. You're the deal maker. You're cutting a deal.

Alan: More like saving spaulding a major headache. Also getting the da to 
keep us out of the line of fire. Also, we're going to root out the source of 
these misappropriated funds.

Gus: Exactly. You got rats in the building? Smoke them out; that's what i 
say.

Alan: I think he's going to want to open up all the records, find out our 
trade secrets.

Gus: Well, if I can, I think this is what you should do. I think you should 
cut him off at the pass, you know, and tell him everything that you know right 
now. Just make it seem important and painful, and I think he'll be happy. That's 
just my opinion. I'm going to...

Alan: Gus? I could use your help today... moral support, if you can spare 
any. I realize you can't be my son in this circumstance, but perhaps you could 
be a part of my legal staff.
Gus: What, you want me to dust off my law degree?
Alan: That would mean a lot to me.
Gus: Yeah, yeah. Sure, let's do it.
Alan: (Laughs)
Bill: No, I ordered a soda.

Waitress: It's from mrs. Spaulding. Her exact words: "Champagne and a buzz 
burger, a meal fit for a young ceo." Congratulations.

Olivia: So, I hear congratulations are in order. Taking over lewis 
construction-- that's nice work, bill.
Bill: Well, look at me: Captain of industry, huh?
Olivia: May I? May I sit?
Bill: Well, how are you?
Olivia: Oh, you know, I'm hanging in.
Bill: Phillip?

Olivia: Doing as well as can be expected. I'm just trying to keep things 
running smoothly.
Bill: I'll bet.

Olivia: So I guess we're going to be spending a lot of time together in the 
near future. With you running lewis construction and me at spaulding, we're 
bound to cross.

Bill: You think? Spaulding-lewis collaborations haven't been so successful in 
the past.
Olivia: Maybe it's time to change that.
Nurse: Anything else, mr. Spaulding?
Phillip: Did they forget my dinner?
Nurse: Mr. Spaulding, you just had lunch.
Phillip: I'm still hungry.
Nurse: Okay, I'll see what i can do.
Rick: Hey, nurse? How's mr. Spaulding doing?
Nurse: Uh, today is not one of his better days.
Rick: Thank you.
Bill: Sounds like you got some big plans for spaulding.
Olivia: Well, yeah. Without a plan.

Bill: I guess not. It must be tough to make a place for yourself over there, 
being a new wife, husband in the hospital.

Olivia: Mm-hmm. Well, that's why I have to plunge in, you know? Protect my 
husband's interest.

Bill: Hm. Well, I'm sure phillip's dad and his aunt alex will be looking out 
after things, too.
Olivia: Come on. You know those two.
Bill: Well, not all that well, actually.

Olivia: Well enough to know they're not exactly the "all for one, one for 
all" lewises, right?

Bill: Well, I guess not, but I'm sure they look out after each other in their 
own special way.
Olivia: My, you're very diplomatic.
Bill: Yeah, well.

Olivia: Look, I don't want to talk about those old fossils, because I'm 
excited about the future.
Bill: Hm.
Olivia: I hope you are, too.

Bill: Well, sometimes. I just didn't expect everything to fall in my lap at 
once.
Olivia: You're more than ready for this, bill.
Bill: It's a big company.
Olivia: So what? They'll still be there for you, your uncle and your dad.

Bill: Well, sure. My dad's still the oil man, an uncle josh will help out 
when he can.
Olivia: I give them a lot of credit for knowing when to hand it over.
Bill: What?

Olivia: Oh, come on. They needed some fresh blood in that stodgy old company. 
Look, I've been reading everything that you've been doing. I even went to the 
development on the north side of the lake. It's beautiful. It's classy but 
affordable.

Bill: (Laughs) really? You know, companies like spaulding and lewis last 
for generations. Do you$want to know why? Because they take their time. They 
build brick by brick. Hb, brandon, my dad, josh...

Olivia: Oh, no, not the history lecture. I'm kidding. I'm not trashing them. 
It's just that I feel like you're a little hesitant or guilty about all this, 
and you can't be. You have to enjoy this, okay? So here's to you, the new head 
of lewis construction; and me, the devoted wife to a hardworking executive, 
okay? Since I'm going to be around, we should hang, bill.
Bill: (Chuckles)
Rick: Hey, buddy. Hey.
Phillip: Hey.

Rick: I had a few minutes off from work, so I thought I'd come by and see 
you. Some magazines.
Phillip: Come by and check me out?
Rick: Come by and see you.
Phillip: Well, in that case, you'll be happy to know I'm doing great.

Rick: Well, that's great, pal. That's really... that's really good. Listen, I 
was really hoping that you'd get out of here in time to, well, you know...
Phillip: Oh. When mel has the baby.
Rick: Right. Should I have not brought that up?
Phillip: You just did.
Rick: Well, I know. I just want to make sure, i mean, are you okay with it?
Phillip: With your happiness?
Rick: Yeah.
Phillip: Of course I am.

Rick: Well, that's good, buddy, because it's really important for mel and I 
that you're a big part of our baby's life.
Phillip: I feel the same way about you being a part of emma's life.
Rick: Emma?
Phillip: My baby with olivia: Emma.
Rick: Right.

Phillip: Looks like our kids are going to grow up together after all, go to 
school, everything-- just like we hoped.
Rick: Phillip, you're not dealing with this.
Phillip: With what?
Rick: The child that you had with olivia died, buddy.
Phillip: Rick, if that were true, don't you think I would know?
Rick: Right.
Phillip: Running away?

Rick: No, actually. As I said, I just had a few minutes to see how you're 
doing, and I've really got to get back to work.
Phillip: Hm. See you soon?

Rick: Absolutely. Absolutely. Nurse? Have dr. Langham call dr. Bauer at 
cedars as soon as possible. I just... I don't like what I'm seeing.
Phillip: "What baby?"
My baby. Emma.
Beth: Phillip? Hi. I brought lizzie for a visit.
Phillip: Hi, baby.
Alan: Alexandra.
Alexandra: Alan, alan.
Gus: How you doing, alexandra?
Alexandra: Could I have a moment with you?
Gus: I'll go tell o'neill we're here.
Alan: What are you doing here? I told you to go to paris.

Alexandra: I am not leaving you alone, not anywhere. Especially not in a 
police station. I'm concerned for both of us right now.

Alan: Funny thing about families: They fight like pit bulls, but when someone 
else throws a shot at us, we remember where our bloodlines lay.
Alexandra: Does that include your newfound son, dear?
Alan: I think gus will protect me where he can.
Alexandra: And just how is gus in any position to protect you?
Alan: He's been working for the feds.
Alexandra: (Gasps)

Alan: He's been working undercover at spaulding to protect me from anything 
they might find.
Alexandra: God. And you believe him? Dear god, alan.

Gus: You're kidding me. Come on, that is not the deal. That is not what I 
told him.
Jeffrey: That's the way it's got to go, gus.

Gus: Look, the only reason he's come down here to deal with you in the first 
place is because he trusts me.
Jeffrey: Yeah, he trusts you.
Gus: He trusts me, yeah, to protect him.

Jeffrey: That's exactly why you have to do this. If I start asking him 
questions, he's going to get his backup, he's going to get defensive, and we're 
not going to find out anything that we can use, okay? You're the one he trusts; 
you're the one that can trip him up. I'm sorry, but that's the way we're going 
to do it.
Gus: I like the way that you keep using the word "we."
Jeffrey: Well, I'm going to be right there with you.

Gus: Oh, are you going to be right there with me? When I watch my 
relationship with my father go down the drain?

Jeffrey: This is an important cause, okay? Try to remember that, okay? 
Believe it or not, there are some things more important than...

Gus: More important than what? Than family? Is that what you were going to 
say?
Jeffrey: Yeah.
Alexandra: Gus?
Alexandra: No, really.

Gus: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Alexandra, you're assaulting a police officer. I 
thought you were a little smarter than that.
Alexandra: Is this how you show your love for your father?
Alan: Alexandra, I told you, he is here to smooth the road for us.
Lawyer: Alan.

Alan: You're late. We're going to go into our meeting now. You, alexandra, 
are going to go home, and I will call you later.
Alexandra: All right.

Lawyer: Alan, are you sure you want to do this? I mean, we don't know what to 
expect in there.

Alan: That's why I have you and my son. A little extra legal mind might come 
in handy.

Lawyer: I don't think that's the wisest idea, alan. Do you understand what's 
going to happen in there?

Alan: No, but whatever happens, I accept full responsibility. I am to blame 
for maryanne caruthers' death. And it must be made clear that none of the other 
four gentlemen with me that night are to blame, or this deal is off. Hey. I'm 
sorry that alexandra hit you.

Gus: Oh, please. I don't give A... I don'T... what you're doing is good, 
okay? It's a good thing. It's good.

Alan: I'm glad you approve. It's the only way I can make amends for that 
woman's death. And I know you think it's too little, too late, but...
Gus: Just be honest.
Alan: It's the best I can do.

Gus: Just be honest when you're in there, okay? No matter what happens, just 
be honest, all right?
Alan: I will.
Jeffrey: Mr. Spaulding.
Alan: Mr. O'neill.
Jeffrey: Please, everyone take their seats.
Lawyer: My client is here to explore possibilities, nothing more.

Jeffrey: All right. We'll dance later. In the event that your client should 
supply information to us which might expose him to criminal liability in any 
case...
Lawyer: Any case?

Gus: Alan is going to get immunity, okay? That's what we're here for. He's

Alan: Wait, wait, wait. What?
Lawyer: "All related entities"?

Alan: Hand over my entire company to the feds?
Gus: Every single receipt. Everything.
Alan: Or what?

Gus: Or your life is going to take a turn for the worse, all right? A turn 
that you can't even begin to possibly imagine.

Ross: Yeah, that's the effect I have on women these days.
Olivia: Eden. Hi, how are you?
Eden: Um, I'm good.

Eden: Always.

Eden: I didn't ask.

Olivia: Hi.
Rick: Hi.
Olivia: The gang's all here.
Ross: Hello, olivia. Nice to see you.
Olivia: You, too. How's the campaign going?

Ross: Oh, it's keeping me very busy, but I plan to take some time out to go

Olivia: You don't have to do that, ross. I mean, really, don't make yourself

Rick: Actually, ross, phillip would love to have the company. I just saw him.

Olivia: Well, you know what? I'm on my way over there as we speak, so I'll

Ross: How nice. Thank you.
Olivia: You're welcome.

Rick: Olivia, phillip's a little bit out of it, and i would... well, she'll

Ross: Okay.

Rick: Okay? Oh, and listen, don't let her scare you away from seeing phillip.

Ross: Not a chance.
Rick: Have a nice day, ross.
Bill: Yeah, yeah. Hold on one second.
Eden: Hi.

Bill: Um, yeah, anyway, i will get those numbers to you later on in the week. 
Okay, thank you. Yes. Yeah, me. Yeah, thank you very much. All right, bye-bye. (

while your uncle is hung out to dry.

Danny: Bill, you are running one of the biggest construction operations in

Bill: You know what, danny? I don't want to talk about it, okay? I want to

Eden: You know what's really fun?
Bill: Besides you?
Eden: Oh, the fact that somehow we are very important people now.
Danny: Yeah. You're a regular power couple.
Bill: No, no, no, not me. I am no big shot, okay?
Eden: Oh, but you are to me.

Danny: Okay, I'm out of here. I'm going to leave you two to your mutual

Bill: Okay, take care.
Danny: Congratulations.

Eden: Bye. So, why do you refuse to admit that you have earned everything

Bill: But eden, did I?
Eden: Okay, do you think your dad and josh are dopes?
Bill: Absolutely not. They're the smartest men I know.
Eden: Really? So, they're comfortable having you run the company.
Bill: I guess so.
Eden: Uh-huh. So it is all good, bill.
Bill: (Laughs)
Eden: And you have me beside you.
Bill: Yeah. So what more can I ask for? Is that...
Eden: Uh-huh.
Danny: Ross.
Ross: Hello, danny. How are you?
Danny: I'm fine. You?
Ross: Never better.

Danny: Good. Actually, I'm glad I ran into you. You have a minute? I want to

Ross: About?
Danny: Um, about campaign tactics.
Ross: Such as?
Danny: Limiting ourselves to civic matters and not personal ones.
Ross: Well, you haven't seen any negative campaigning from me.
Danny: No, I haven'T. Not yet.
Ross: I believe I'm about to be offended.
Danny: Well, I hope not. I just want to make sure we have an understanding.

Ross: Look, danny, if this is about your past, I told you before that you 
can't run from it. I'm not going to ignore it, because there's going to be some 
point in this campaign when we're going to talk about law and order, and I was 
elected several times to represent the law. On the other hand, you were known 
for breaking it.
Danny: I know, ross, and I'm ready for that. Knock yourself out.
Ross: Well, then what are you afraid of?

Danny: I'm not afraid of anything. I just don't want you to take any shots at 
my wife.
Alan: You have set me up.
Gus: No. No, I haven't, alan.
Lawyer: Then what is this line of questioning about, detective aitoro?
Alan: You said you were going to help me.
Gus: I am trying to help you!
Alan: Then tell me why I feel blood running down my back, huh?
Gus: Can you please just calm... look, this is a negotiation.
Lawyer: I thought that was the da's job. You were supposed to be on our side.
Gus: Yeah, well.. I'm the liaison.
Alan: What? What liaison? What?

Gus: I am simply reiterating the deal on the table, alan, as I see it. We 
discussed this!

Alan: We did not discuss this. I said I would cooperate with an investigation 
that was limited to the pharmaceutical division. That's the area that will stink 
in our company, and you might find something...
Gus: Fine! Fine. Just tell us why that... why is that? Just tell us why.
Alan: Because I paid very little attention to that area.
Lawyer: Alan.

Alan: Because I am not interested. I gave that division to alexandra to keep 
her busy. She could do whatever she wants with it.
Gus: Okay, so just the pharmaceutical division?

Alan: Yes. And you have my blessing to look at it, to crawl all over it, find 
whatever you want, but you are not going to scoop my entire company. My god, 
it's a huge conglomerate. One of the divisions manufactures baby food, for god's 
sake.
Jeffrey: All right. That's good enough for me.

Gus: Look, just sit down, okay? You start talking, nobody's going to stop 
you, no one's going to interrupt you. We'll just get this over with.

Alan: Ten years ago, i noticed something odd on the yearend balance sheet. 
Antimonius was being sold to developing countries for half the cost.
Gus: And why is that?
Jeffrey: It's a generic version that's still profitable. Go ahead.

Alan: Think about it. If the people that pay full price found out about this 
deal, they would want the same one and our stocks would plummet.
Gus: Who orchestrated this?

Alan: My money is on brad greene. Alexandra went along with anything he 
wanted to do. Now, it's very complicated, and he understood it all and he 
assured us that everything about it was legal.

Jeffrey: Well, that's a nice story, alan. Too bad it's not the whole story, 
is it?
Alan: What do you mean, the whole story?

Gus: Look, alan, we happen to know that there's a little bit more to it than 
that.
Alan: What more, gus?
Gus: Why do you have to be so difficult? Why?

Lawyer: Detective, alan is trying to cooperate. You are the one that is being 
difficult.

Gus: Can you just close your mouth for a minute? Look, you're screwing me 
here, okay? There's a deal on the table. We know what you're doing, we know 
what's going on, so if you want the deal... I've got to hear the words come out 
of your mouth, alan. You've got to speak the words now, or forever lose your 
deal.

Alan: I came here today in good faith with information about spaulding 
pharmaceuticals in exchange for a break in what happened with maryanne caruthers.
Gus: Yes. Okay, but what we're looking for, alan...
Alan: What "we're"?
Gus: Yes.
Alan: "We're looking..."

Gus: Look, we know about the antimonious, okay? Let's just put that on the 
table. We know about that. We know about the missing shipments that are being 
diverted. And we know that that is being used to create a street drug called 
delirium, okay. The trafficking of that drug, the control of that drug is 
organized crime.
Alan: What the hell are you suggesting?

Lawyer: Are you suggesting that my client is involved with dealing illegal 
drugs?
Gus: Well, that's what I'd like to know.

Alan: Are you suggesting... are you suggesting that our company is involved 
with the mob? Are you accusing alexandra and me of being drug dealers? Do you 
honestly believe that you come up from a family of drug dealers?
Gus: Honestly, alan, I don't know. Right now, I could. I don't know.

Alan: You son of A... you know what? I could swallow... I swallow your 
working undercover at spaulding without telling me. And I could buy your trying 
to protect me, gus. But this has been an ambush, gentlemen. Congratulations on 
your attempt to bring down spaulding. You came very close. But there's one thing 
you missed. You do not have what it takes to bring me down.

Ross: Why in god's name do you believe it necessary to have this 
conversation? You think I would make a campaign issue out of michelle?
Danny: You're representing marah in the shooting at the fairgrounds, right?
Ross: Yeah. How is that relevant?
Danny: Ross, michelle was there.

Ross: But reports were made to the police that said michelle wasn't even in 
the building when the shooting occurred.
Danny: I know. And that's true.
Ross: So?

Danny: Ross, you and I both know how things could be spun. Michelle was in 
the vicinity of a shooting; I'm running for mayor; a candidate's private life is 
not always off limits.
Ross: We've known each other a long time, danny. Who do you think I am?

Danny: All I'm saying is you can drag whatever you want into this campaign-- 
carmen, my past, my bank accounts, tony, whoever you may see me with, the color 
of my shirt-- I don't care. But leave michelle and robbie alone.
Ross: You know, this conversion is not only offensive, it's a waste of time.

Phillip: You think I'm crazy. Well, of course you think I'm crazy. Look where 
I am. And I may be. But I'm not about this.
Beth: Okay, phillip, okay.

Phillip: I'm not, beth. Just believe me. I saw her. I saw her and I held her. 
Lizzie, your sister's alive.
Lizzie: Okay, daddy.
Phillip: Do you believe me?
Lizzie: I...

Phillip: Honey, you... i need... I need for you to believe me, okay? I really 
do. She's the most beautiful little baby you've ever seen in your life, other 
than you, of course. Actually she looks just like you. She's just... she's not 
you. She's her. But it took me back to when you were born.

Beth: Phillip, I know that this all seems very real to you. But we have to 
find a way for you to understand that your baby with olivia died.
Phillip: No.
Beth: Yes.

Phillip: No, no, no. No, beth, I'm telling you, i was... I had her here. I
